entry.summary:
Anything you see below this is old news

Around the end of 2011, I had stopped blogging. I had created a photography website using wordpress and was trying to make a living for myself as any recent college graduate would.

However, I didn’t go to school in photography, I had studied chemistry. But upon realizing the difficulties associated with getting any work with only an undergrad education, I chose photography since I was good at it, and I had some experience doing it professionally. I also was preparing ultimately to go study medicine, and it was my 2nd year of having gone through the application process.

But something happened

I got a job in Santa Barbara in fabricating the next generation of photonic. It was a real job, the technology was something lost during the dotcom bubble, but now at resurgence of cloud computing and the demand of our telecommunications infrastructure. It was something I believed in, information travling at the speed of light through optical fiber, and satisfied that itch for uncovering new and novel ideas, so I took it.

Since then, I’ve learned a lot. So I’ve decided to start blogging again.

All the content below this was generated from my old blog. I was able to write a program that scraped my old posts through the tumblr API and convert it into reStructuredText. This new blog is now generated by the pelican blogging engine which I’ve customized to fit my needs. I had to rewrite some of the blogging engine as well as rewrite entire plugins due to compatability reasons between Python 3 & 2, or because I just for the fun of it.

I hope you enjoy and follow along.
